member.name: Windows.TaskDialog
member.summary: The TaskDialog function creates, displays, and operates a task dialog. The task dialog contains application-defined message text and title, icons, and any combination of predefined push buttons. This function does not support the registration of a callback function to receive notifications.
member.param: Handle to the owner window of the task dialog to be created. If this parameter is NULL, the task dialog has no owner window.

Handle to the module that contains the icon resource identified by the pszIcon member, and the string resources identified by the pszWindowTitle and pszMainInstruction members. If this parameter is NULL, pszIcon must be NULL or a pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains a system resource identifier, for example, TD_ERROR_ICON.

Pointer to the string to be used for the task dialog title. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the macro. If this parameter is NULL, the filename of the executable program is used.

Pointer to the string to be used for the main instruction. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the macro. This parameter can be NULL if no main instruction is wanted.

Pointer to a string used for additional text that appears below the main instruction, in a smaller font. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the macro. Can be NULL if no additional text is wanted.

param.name: dwCommonButtons
param.para: Specifies the push buttons displayed in the dialog box. This parameter may be a combination of flags from the following group.
param.div: Note If no buttons are specified, the dialog box will contain the OK button by default.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The task dialog contains the push button: OK.
The task dialog contains the push button: Yes.
The task dialog contains the push button: No.
The task dialog contains the push button: Cancel. This button must be specified for the dialog box to respond to typical cancel actions (Alt-F4 and Escape).
The task dialog contains the push button: Retry.
The task dialog contains the push button: Close.

param.name: pszIcon
param.para: Pointer to a string that identifies the icon to display in the task dialog. This parameter must be an integer resource identifier passed to the macro or one of the following predefined values. If this parameter is NULL, no icon will be displayed. If the hInstance parameter is NULL and one of the predefined values is not used, the TaskDialog function fails.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
A stop-sign icon appears in the task dialog.
An icon consisting of a lowercase letter i in a circle appears in the task dialog.
A security shield icon appears in the task dialog.
An exclamation-point icon appears in the task dialog.

param.name: pnButton
param.para: When this function returns, contains a pointer to an integer location that receives one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value
Description
Function call failed. Refer to return value for more information.
Cancel button was selected, Alt-F4 was pressed, Escape was pressed or the user clicked on the close window button.
No button was selected.
OK button was selected.
Retry button was selected.
Yes button was selected.
Close button was selected.

param.para: If this value is NULL, no value is returned.

returns.para: This function can return one of these values.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The operation completed successfully.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.
One or more arguments are not valid.
The operation failed.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_HitTest
member.summary: Determines the location of the specified point relative to the client area of a tree-view control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_HITTEST message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.

Pointer to a structure. When the message is sent, the pt member specifies the coordinates of the point to test. When the message returns, the hItem member is the handle to the item at the specified point or NULL if no item occupies the point. Also, when the message returns, the flags member is a hit test value that indicates the location of the specified point. For a list of hit test values, see the description of the TVHITTESTINFO structure.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_Select
member.summary: Selects the specified tree-view item, scrolls the item into view, or redraws the item in the style used to indicate the target of a drag-and-drop operation. You can use this macro or the , , or macros, or you can send the TVM_SELECTITEM message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Handle to an item. If the hitem parameter is NULL, the control is set to have no selected item.

param.name: code
param.para: Action flag. This parameter can be one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Sets the selection to the given item. The control's parent window receives the TVN_SELCHANGING and TVN_SELCHANGED notification codes.
Redraws the given item in the style used to indicate the target of a drag-and-drop operation.

Ensures that the specified item is visible, and, if possible, displays it at the top of the control's window. Tree-view controls display as many items as will fit in the window. If the specified item is near the bottom of the control's hierarchy of items, it might not become the first visible item, depending on how many items fit in the window.

Handle to an item. If the hitem parameter is NULL, the control is set to have no selected item.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SelectSetFirstVisible
member.summary: Scrolls the tree-view control vertically to ensure that the specified item is visible. If possible, the specified item becomes the first visible item at the top of the control's window. You can use this macro or the macro, or you can send the TVM_SELECTITEM message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Handle to an item. If the hitem parameter is NULL, the control is set to have no selected item.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetAutoScrollInfo
member.summary: Sets information used to determine auto-scroll characteristics. Use this macro or send the TVM_SETAUTOSCROLLINFO message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Specifies pixels per second. The offset to scroll is divided by the uPixPerSec to determine the total duration of the auto-scroll.

Specifies the redraw time interval. Redraw at every elapsed interval, until the item is scrolled into view. Given uPixPerSec, the location of the item is calculated and a repaint occurs. Set this value to create smooth scrolling.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetBkColor
member.summary: Sets the background color of the control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETBKCOLOR message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to a tree-view control.
COLORREF value that contains the new background color. If this argument is -1, the control will revert to using the system color for the background color.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetCheckState
member.summary: Sets the item's state image to "checked" or "unchecked." You can also use the TVM_SETITEM message directly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Handle to the item.
Value that indicates which state image is displayed. SetfCheck to TRUE to display the checked state image or FALSE to display the unchecked image.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetExtendedStyle
member.summary: Sets the extended style for a specified TreeView control. Use this macro or send the TVM_SETEXTENDEDSTYLE message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the TreeView control.
Value that indicates the extended style. For more information on styles, see Tree-View Control Extended Styles.
Mask used to select the styles to be set.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetImageList
member.summary: Sets the normal or state image list for a tree-view control and redraws the control using the new images. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETIMAGELIST message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
The HIMAGELIST handle to the image list. If himl is NULL, the message removes the specified image list from the tree-view control.

param.name: iImage
param.para: Type of image list to set. This parameter can be one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Indicates the normal image list, which contains selected, nonselected, and overlay images for the items of a tree-view control.
Indicates the state image list. You can use state images to indicate application-defined item states. A state image is displayed to the left of an item's selected or nonselected image.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetIndent
member.summary: Sets the width of indentation for a tree-view control and redraws the control to reflect the new width. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETINDENT message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Width, in pixels, of the indentation. If this parameter is less than the system-defined minimum width, the new width is set to the system-defined minimum.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetInsertMark
member.summary: Sets the insertion mark in a tree-view control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETINSERTMARK message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to a tree-view control.
HTREEITEM that specifies at which item the insertion mark will be placed. If this argument is NULL, the insertion mark is removed.

BOOL value that specifies if the insertion mark is placed before or after the specified item. If this argument is nonzero, the insertion mark will be placed after the item. If this argument is zero, the insertion mark will be placed before the item.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetInsertMarkColor
member.summary: Sets the color used to draw the insertion mark for the tree view. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETINSERTMARKCOLOR message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to a tree-view control.
COLORREF value that contains the new insertion mark color.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetItem
member.summary: The TreeView_SetItem macro sets some or all of a tree-view item's attributes. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETITEM message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Pointer to a structure that contains the new item attributes. With version 4.71 and later, you can instead use a structure.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetItemHeight
member.summary: Sets the height of the tree-view items. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETITEMHEIGHT message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to a tree-view control.

New height of every item in the tree view, in pixels. Heights less than 1 will be set to 1. If this argument is not even, it will be rounded down to the nearest even value. If this argument is -1, the control will revert to using its default item height.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetItemState

Value that is equivalent to the state member of .
Mask used to select the states to be set. It is equivalent to thestateMask member of .

A COLORREF that specifies the new line color. Use the CLR_DEFAULT value to restore the system default colors.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetScrollTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum scroll time for the tree-view control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETSCROLLTIME message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to a tree-view control.
New maximum scroll time, in milliseconds. If this value is less than 100, it will be rounded up to 100.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SetUnicodeFormat
member.summary: Sets the Unicode character format flag for the control. This message allows you to change the character set used by the control at run time rather than having to re-create the control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SETUNICODEFORMAT message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the control.
Determines the character set that is used by the control. If this value is nonzero, the control will use Unicode characters. If this value is zero, the control will use ANSI characters.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_ShowInfoTip
member.summary: Shows the infotip for a specified item in a tree-view control. Use this macro or send the TVM_SHOWINFOTIP message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Handle to the item.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SortChildren
member.summary: Sorts the child items of the specified parent item in a tree-view control. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SORTCHILDREN message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.
Handle to the parent item whose child items are to be sorted.
Value that specifies whether the sorting is recursive. Set fRecurse to TRUE to sort all levels of child items below the parent item. Otherwise, only the parent's immediate children are sorted.

member.name: Windows.TreeView_SortChildrenCB
member.summary: Sorts tree-view items using an application-defined callback function that compares the items. You can use this macro or send the TVM_SORTCHILDRENCB message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the tree-view control.

Pointer to a structure. The lpfnCompare member is the address of the application-defined callback function, which is called during the sort operation each time the relative order of two list items needs to be compared. For more information about the callback function, see the description of TVSORTCB.
Reserved. Must be zero.

member.name: Windows.UninitializeFlatSB
member.summary: Uninitializes flat scroll bars for a particular window. The specified window will revert to standard scroll bars.
member.param: A handle to the window with the flat scroll bars that will be uninitialized.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
One of the window's scroll bars is currently in use. The operation cannot be completed at this time.
The window does not have flat scroll bars initialized.
The operation was successful.

member.name: Windows._TrackMouseEvent
member.summary: Posts messages when the mouse pointer leaves a window or hovers over a window for a specified amount of time. This function calls if it exists, otherwise it emulates it.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains tracking information.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, return value is zero.
